channel.title: Lotus Docs Example Site
channel.description: Recent content on Lotus Docs Example Site

item.title: First Post
item.description: This is my first post. linkIt is a test of the Hugo site builder. I hope everything is displaying correctly Do the different headings display? linkLorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus posuere viverra justo vitae fermentum. Nam sit amet condimentum sapien, in finibus massa. Pellentesque posuere augue eu metus faucibus, quis scelerisque dui gravida. Morbi velit nunc, ultrices eu quam vitae, maximus faucibus sapien. Vivamus ac aliquet justo.

item.title: Démarrage rapide
item.description: Créer un nouveau contenu Navigate to the root of your Hugo project and use the hugo new command to create a file in the content/docs directory: hugo new docs/example-page.md This will create a markdown file named example-page.md with the following default front matter: +++ title = "Example Page" description = "" icon = "article" date = "2023-05-22T00:27:57+01:00" lastmod = "2023-05-22T00:27:57+01:00" draft = false toc = true weight = 999 +++ Modify the options to suit your needs.

item.title: Quickstart
item.description: Requirements link git Go ≥ v1.19 Hugo ≥ v0.100.0 (Extended Version) Install Hugo linkInstall the Hugo CLI, using the specific instructions for your operating system below: Linux Homebrew (macOS) Windows (Chocolatey) Windows (Scoop) Your Linux distro’s package manager may include Hugo. If this is the case, install it directly using your distro’s package manager – for instance, in Ubuntu, run the following command. This will install the extended edition of Hugo:

item.title: Schnellstart
item.description: Neue Inhalte erstellen Navigate to the root of your Hugo project and use the hugo new command to create a file in the content/docs directory: hugo new docs/example-page.md This will create a markdown file named example-page.md with the following default front matter: +++ title = "Example Page" description = "" icon = "article" date = "2023-05-22T00:27:57+01:00" lastmod = "2023-05-22T00:27:57+01:00" draft = false toc = true weight = 999 +++ Modify the options to suit your needs.

item.title: Code
item.description: warning The front matter description value for this page has been intentionally left empty in order to demonstrate FlexSearch’s suggested results fallback behaviour. Code Block Examples linkCode block language examples Go link package main import "fmt" func main() { fmt.Println("hello world") } HTML link <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <body> <h1>My First Heading</h1> <p>My first paragraph.</p> </body> </html> Markdown link # H1 heading **Some bold text** *Italic text example*

item.title: Code
item.description: Code Block Examples Code block language examples Go package main import "fmt" func main() { fmt.Println("hello world") } HTML <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <body> <h1>My First Heading</h1> <p>My first paragraph.</p> </body> </html> Markdown # H1 heading **Some bold text** *Italic text example*

item.title: Mermaid
item.description: Flowchart linkflowchart LR A[Hard] -->|Text| B(Round) B --> C{Decision} C -->|One| D[Result 1] C -->|Two| E[Result 2] Sequence diagram linksequenceDiagram Alice->>John: Hello John, how are you? loop Healthcheck John->>John: Fight against hypochondria end Note right of John: Rational thoughts! John-->>Alice: Great! John->>Bob: How about you? Bob-->>John: Jolly good! Gnatt Chart linkgantt section Section Completed :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08 Active :active, des2, 2014-01-07, 3d Parallel 1 : des3, after des1, 1d Parallel 2 : des4, after des1, 1d Parallel 3 : des5, after des3, 1d Parallel 4 : des6, after des4, 1d Class diagram linkclassDiagram Class01 <|-- AveryLongClass : Cool <<interface>> Class01 Class09 --> C2 : Where am i?
